sentences.sContent: It was a relief to be back in familiar surroundings .
sentences.sCn: 回到熟悉的环境里让人松了一口气。

sentences.sContent: Beggars on the street are becoming a familiar sight .
sentences.sCn: 街上出现乞丐的情况逐渐变得屡见不鲜。

sentences.sContent: This kind of situation was all too familiar (= very familiar ) to John.
sentences.sCn: 这种情形对约翰来说太熟悉了。

sentences.sContent: Her face seems vaguely familiar , but I can’t quite place her.
sentences.sCn: 她看起来有点面熟，但我还是认不出她来。

sentences.sContent: ...Monaco became familiar to Americans when its ruler...
...Most people are familiar with the works of William Shakespeare...
...it is familiar to anyone who has completed a not smoking program...
...This place doesn’t look familiar at all...
...most of the British public is familiar even with the extremes of Heston Blumenthal's molecular gastronomy...
...it wanted a leader familiar with the state government...

phrases.pCn: 简体，非正式文体；家常体

words.tran: 不拘礼节地；亲密地；精通地

trans.tranOther: someone or something that is familiar is well-known to you and easy to recognize
